title: Seven confirms Big Brother reboot WON'T be aired live
text:
Channel Seven has confirmed rumours that the upcoming Big Brother reboot will feature massive format changes.

Speaking to TV Tonight, the Network's Director of Programming, Angus Ross, said the 2020 series will be pre-recorded like a standard reality show, instead of airing live like it has in the past.

'I don't want to go into the specifics of what we're planning because some of them are still to be debated but it won't be live, he said.

Oh, no! Channel Seven's Director of Programming, Angus Ross, has confirmed the Big Brother reboot will be pre-recorded

Angus added the show will however have a host but it is still unclear whether former host Gretel Killeen will be returning.

'There are certain nods to nostalgia required with that show. Like any show there are super-fans and we certainly don't want to alienate them,' he explained.

Gretel previously hosted Big Brother for seven seasons on Channel 10 before being replaced by Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson in 2008.

Flashback: The original Big Brother format featured live episodes and evictions

Changes: The show will reportedly be pre-recorded months before airing and the public will also be excluded from the voting process, according to TV Blackbox

This comes after TV Blackbox reported that the new 2020 season of Big Brother will be filmed in April but won't air on TV until August.

The public will also reportedly be excluded from the voting process, with the contestants instead voting each other out, similar to Australian Survivor.

TV Blackbox also reported that due to cost-cutting measures, the show will be filmed in a 'warehouse' instead of the traditional house setting.

Will she be back? The reboot is however expected to have a host but it is still unclear whether former host Gretel Killeen (left) will be returning

Earlier this month, it was confirmed that Big Brother Australia will be returning for a new season in 2020.

Channel Seven will reportedly finance the show using the budget originally allocated for the now-cancelled current affairs program Sunday Night.

Production company Endemol Shine has already opened applications for Big Brother 2020 and potential housemates can apply online.
description: Channel Seven has confirmed rumours that the upcoming Big Brother reboot will feature massive format changes.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
